fields.description:
I just created new account and forgot to write down freshly generated password.\\
Can not get it back. Always getting:

Reset password\\
Sorry! This password reset link is no longer valid.\\
Try again

I can't reset my password it says:\\
"Sorry! This password reset link is no longer valid. Try again"
I try to reset my password.... and get the following message  "Sorry! This password reset link is no longer valid."

I like to have way to configure visible columns for project issues tracker. It is already dynamically changed if I change settings. I want to be able disable "votes", "created", "updated", "priority", "status" or "type" columns. This columns are not useful for some projects, but consume space from other more important columns.

In attachment example that show how much space consumed by these columns.

Hi,

Been playing around with Bitbucket's Multiple Hosted Websites feature and have found that this does not seem to work with Mercurial's {{.hgsub}} subrepository feature.

See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+Bitbucket

By all rights according to this above document, this should work.

For an example see: http://bitbucket.org/prologic/prologic.bitbucket.org

* http://prologic.bitbucket.org/ < works
* http://prologic.bitbucket.org/ports/ < doesn't work --> 404 Not Found
* http://prologic.bitbucket.org/ports/index.html < doesn't work --> 404 Not Found

This seems like an easy thing to fix because the subrepositories are normally just "checked out" full clones of the referenced repository. f Bitbucket is just simply not cloning and checking these out, then doing so would probably fix the issue?

cheers\\
James
fields.summary: Hosting Multiple Sites via Mercurial's .hgsub subrepositories (BB-10182)

fields.description:
When deleting an email address from account management page, when more than one email is present the list shows as if a different address was deleted instead. Page is displayed correctly after manual refresh.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Have three emails in the user email addresses list:

#* secondary2@example.com
#* secondary1@example.com
#* primary@example.com
# Click on delete button near secondary2@example.com

*Expected outcome:*

Email list shows {{secondary1@example.com}} and {{primary@example.com}} email addresses.

*Actual outcome:*

Email list shows {{secondary2@example.com}} and {{secondary1@example.com}} email addresses.
fields.summary: Wrong email list shown after deleting a secondary email address (BB-10171)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket,

We are not receiving all email updates to issues in your issue tracker. We have investigated this and the cause seems to come down to duplicated message id's.\\
Normally all emails have a unique message id, and many mail servers have a filter on them which prevents messages with the same id being delivered multiple times to an individual.

It seems that when issues on BitBucket are updated, the update emails for a particular issue are sent out with the same id, which means that our email system only delivers the first one. Please could you investigate and see whether this behaviour can be altered so that all update emails get unique ids.

As an example, we created [this issue|https://bitbucket.org/MartinEden/framelog/issue/27/a-test-issue-to-demonstrate-email-issue]. We added 2 updates to it, and between them, we changed Stuart's email address to a different LShift account, which allowed us to avoid the email being dropped due to duplication.

We then examined the headers which are included below. You can see that the Message ID is the same in both messages, which should not happen.

Message 1 headers:

{code}
Return-Path: <issues-reply@bitbucket.org>
Received: from agentj.lshift.net (localhost [::1])
	 by agentj (Cyrus v2.2.13-Debian-2.2.13-19squeeze3build0.10.04.1) with LMTPA;
	 Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:42:02 +0000
X-Sieve: CMU Sieve 2.2
Received: from lb01-ash.bitbucket.org ([131.103.20.165] helo=lb01.bitbucket.org)
	by agentj.lshift.net with esmtp (Exim 4.71)
	(envelope-from <issues-reply@bitbucket.org>)
	id 1WHybR-0005Rx-Tc
	for stuart@lshift.net; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:42:02 +0000
Received: from app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org [172.17.10.38])
	by lb01.bitbucket.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id 8CA171B4168F
	for <stuart@lshift.net>; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:41:56 +0000 (UTC)
Received: from app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (localhost [127.0.0.1])
	by app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id 844B59C0055
	for <stuart@lshift.net>; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:41:56 +0000 (UTC)
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
 boundary="===============6524968487279699052=="
MIME-Version: 1.0
Subject: Re: [Bitbucket] Issue BCLOUD-27: A test issue to demonstrate email issue
 (MartinEden/framelog)
From: "Martin Eden" <issues-reply@bitbucket.org>
To: stuart@lshift.net
Date: Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:41:56 -0000
Message-ID: <issues-a5c1880fcc03b341f23410217aae31b1/updated@bitbucket.org>
References: <issues-a5c1880fcc03b341f23410217aae31b1@bitbucket.org>
In-Reply-To: <issues-a5c1880fcc03b341f23410217aae31b1@bitbucket.org>
X-SA-Score: 0.0
{code}

Message 2 headers

{code}
Return-Path: <cyrus@agentj>
Received: from murder ([unix socket])
	 by agentj (Cyrus v2.2.13-Debian-2.2.13-19squeeze3build0.10.04.1) with LMTPA;
	 Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:52:37 +0000
X-Sieve: CMU Sieve 2.2
Received: from lb01-ash.bitbucket.org ([131.103.20.165] helo=lb01.bitbucket.org)
	by agentj.lshift.net with esmtp (Exim 4.71)
	(envelope-from <issues-reply@bitbucket.org>)
	id 1WHylh-0005an-1t
	for noc@lshift.net; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:52:37 +0000
Received: from app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org [172.17.10.38])
	by lb01.bitbucket.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id DDFC21B41540
	for <noc@lshift.net>; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:52:30 +0000 (UTC)
Received: from app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (localhost [127.0.0.1])
	by app18.ash-private.bitbucket.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id DDB099C0055
	for <noc@lshift.net>; Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:52:30 +0000 (UTC)
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
 boundary="===============3217501506750673135=="
MIME-Version: 1.0
Subject: Re: [Bitbucket] Issue BCLOUD-27: A test issue to demonstrate email issue
 (MartinEden/framelog)
From: "Martin Eden" <issues-reply@bitbucket.org>
To: noc@lshift.net
Date: Mon, 24 Feb 2014 16:52:30 -0000

{code}

fields.description:
Issue description:

The downloading speed is too slow from Redwood City, California to Bitbucket.org.\\
Confirmed our company internet is no problem.\\
Tested from Canada the downloading speed is much faster and latency is lower.

Checked the trace route, found high latency started from 129.250.4.102 which belongs to Bitbucket’s service provider. (Log as below)

It’s affecting our daily work and please fix it as soon as possible. Thank you.

RWC----------------------------------------------\\
traceroute to bitbucket.org (131.103.20.168), 30 hops max, 40 byte packets\\
1  10.17.220.3 (10.17.220.3)  0.271 ms  0.277 ms  0.304 ms\\
2  199.3.180.2 (199.3.180.2)  0.896 ms  0.890 ms  0.880 ms\\
3  sl-gw19-sj-0-2-1-0-si205.sprintlink.net (144.228.111.209)  6.994 ms  6.855 ms  5.845 ms\\
4  144.232.0.249 (144.232.0.249)  4.404 ms  3.410 ms  3.400 ms\\
5  144.232.7.142 (144.232.7.142)  4.326 ms  6.305 ms  4.306 ms\\
6  144.232.25.98 (144.232.25.98)  5.483 ms  5.475 ms  5.464 ms\\
7  ae-6.r20.snjsca04.us.bb.gin.ntt.net (129.250.5.12)  4.201 ms  4.181 ms  4.176 ms\\
8  ae-4.r21.asbnva02.us.bb.gin.ntt.net (129.250.4.102)  81.534 ms  78.276 ms  76.629 ms\\
9  ae-2.r00.asbnva02.us.bb.gin.ntt.net (129.250.3.114)  77.666 ms ae-2.r04.asbnva02.us.bb.gin.ntt.net (129.250.4.207)  79.681 ms\\
ae2.r00.asbnva02.us.bb.gin.ntt.net (129.250.3.114)  79.116 ms\\
10  po-2.a00.asbnva03.us.da.verio.net (129.250.29.130)  84.979 ms po-1.a00.asbnva03.us.da.verio.net (129.250.27.130)  80.173 ms po-\\

Thanks

fields.description:
Today one of my team mates registered a bitbucket account using the team's email address. I accidentally clicked on the "Confirm email address" link, and the email address has been added to my account. He then asked for a password reset using that address, and successfully reset my password despite I removed the address from my account earlier.

_Email address confirmation tokens should be associated with accounts, and password reset tokens should be associated with the email address and the account._

*To reproduce the issue:*

* add an email address to my account
* confirm it
* ask a password reset or that email address
* remove the address from my account
* click on the reset password link

*Desired outcome:*

An error message saying that there is no account for that email address.

*Current outcome:*

Password is changed on the account which that email address is no longer assigned to.
fields.summary: Tie password reset tokens to the email address they were sent to (BB-10139)

As far as I know closing a branch in mercurial is just marking it; so it won't show up in branches and heads.

fields.description:
Issue BCLOUD-6107 was closed two days after it was opened, and since then has received many +1's to the point where it warrants revisiting.

While the original ticket asked for quite a bit of functionality, given the comments i'd suggest limiting the request to "The ability to squash pull requests".
fields.summary: Provide the option to use "git merge --squash" for pull requests (BB-10142)

fields.description:
While you can fork a repository and choose a different main branch, there is no way to specify the upstream branch to use for notification and syncing. Bitbucket currently only allows merging the "master" branch into the main branch of your fork, no selection of other branches to merge.

Thus the suggestion: add an option to the Repository details which allows selecting an upstream branch to track and use for notification/sync.
fields.summary: Allow forks to sync with a branch other than the upstream's main branch (BB-10157)

fields.description:
Hi

i have some issue with bitbucket with Jenkins when simply we enter url then it build url but when we push into bitbucket it not start build.

Please resolve it or suggest me right way.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Hook Management issue with jenkins

fields.description: Please could the site have a mobile website, or a responsive website. This would enable wiki, issue and code creation and editing, via mobiles.

When looking at the commit detail for a git repository, such as [this one|https://bitbucket.org/musicant/testagain/commits/4fe9d15bd4ee572a1700f9f593776ef27c2209dc] there is a field on the right-hand side labeled "Branches" that seems to be wrong, or at least, unclear. For this particular commit I've linked to (i.e., 4fe9d15), it shows "master" as the branch. But that commit has two different branches as descendants: "master" and "side"; both of these tips can be seen as descending from this commit in [this overview|https://bitbucket.org/musicant/testagain/commits/all]. Perhaps this branches field is intended to indicate which branch the project was on when the commit was made, but to the best of my knowledge this can't be done; this info is only available in the reflog, which isn't pushed.

Is this a bug and "branches" should show all descendant branches (which it doesn't), or a poorly documented feature? If the latter, what is this field showing?
fields.summary: Branches field in commit detail is questionable

fields.description:
In the issue list of the personal Dashboard, the repositories should be linked / clickable.

I'm always annoyed when I'm in the issue list and can't browse to the repository of the issue.

This is just a little improvement that requires almost no work and would avoid a lot of annoyance for me.

-> Low hanging fruit, go get it :)
fields.summary: Make repository name in dashboard lists clickable, in addition to the logo (BB-10124)

fields.description:
Our team is trying to use bookmarks for feature branches, even if they are not [fully supported|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6705/cant-create-pull-request-from-hg-bookmark].

We use {{master}} bookmark, to assign it to main history line, all other bookmarks are feature branches.

Most annoying issue with bookmarks for feature branches flow is {{master}} bookmark updates when branch is merged from bitbucket.org web site. Bitbucket does not move {{master}} no new merge commit, and whole team always have to update {{master}} to new changeset manually.

This can be fixed if Bitbucket would allow to specify default active bookmark in repository settings as it is possible with named branches. If this default active bookmark is specified, all merges and other commits from BitBucket must be made with this bookmark activated.

Then, everyone will get {{master}} updated to right position in commit history.

Hi\\
My account has been deactivated after creation can you please activate it.\\
nkm76 is my id.

The last few days, I've sometimes gotten permission errors when pushing changes via ssh/git. Pushing may work fine for several hours, before I suddenly get this error:

{code}
Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
{code}

The problem persists for a while (~30 minutes or an hour), and then everything works fine again. While it lasts, the problem is there for several or all of my repositories. The problem vanishes without any intervention from my side, other than waiting.

I don't commit unusually often or with large change sets. The changes are most often just a few lines, and the problem emerged today with 8 commits within 3 hours.

We are getting 500 error trying to view or create pull request on our repo, this needs resolving asap.

code from error page: d7d1007cc43944d1aa696999bae13773
I've tried to updload to download section a file with 1GB size e received this error:\\ \\

(i am new to git and completely new to bitbucket. apologies in advance if i have offended any shibboleths or not included vital information.)

this is really a push issue i think, but i could not find a push category in the 'component' dropdown list, so i chose what seemed like the nearest item, namely 'pull requests'.

i am using git on windows 7, trying to push to bitbucket. i get this error:

$ git push -u origin --all # pushes up the repo and its refs for the first time\\
fatal: could not read Password for 'https://bootstrap9@bitbucket.org': No such file or directory

unless i am simply missing a vital step, i gather from stackoverflow etc that the problem is almost certainly caused by a bug in Git 1.8.5.2 for windows. whilst i wait for the windows version of 1.9, is there any reasonably simple way around this? otherwise it means i simply cannot use bitbucket, and for the moment, will have to find another solution.

thanks,\\
julian
fields.summary: bitbucket will not work with Git 1.8.5.2 Windows version

fields.description:
Error exists for *near 3 days*. Push error info as below：

_Counting objects: 108, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (65/65), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (65/65), 14.29 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.\\

The problem has blocked our work. Please help fix ASAP.

Thanks,
When you fork a repo and choose that you want a private fork, it will be still listed in {{forks}} in the source repo.
fields.summary: Private forks are showed up in original repo

fields.description:
For testing purposes, I have to add DOS, UN*X and MAC file format.

When creating the pull request, the mac format file is not displayed. There is a place holder with the filename, but the content is missing. This is a new file. I am not sure of the behavior when a file is changed.

Also, the "Side-by-side diff" button is missing.
fields.summary: New files created in the old Mac file format do not appear in diffs (BB-10156)

fields.description: I updated my avatar in bitbucket, when I clone repository in sourcetree it's not showing my avatar
fields.summary: Avatar is not showing in sourcetree

fields.description:
When I try to sync my fork with the master (if you want to try: https://bitbucket.org/Marsu42/ml-mod6d) I'm getting the error message "Unable to merge - conflicts during merge". Problem is: even after resolving all issues with files marked with "conflict" in the diff, it still fails w/o any file marked as a problem - unlike the promised "View the conflicts".

I have encountered this problem multiple times by now and the only solution I found is to completely reset, i.e. delete the repo, re-fork and re-patch in all my changes. Is there any way to find out what the problem is?
fields.summary: "Sync repository" fails w/o any indication why?!

fields.description:
Following guidelines from this page "https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+Bitbucket", I created a repository named "xxxx.bitbucket.org". After fulfilling the steps, when I opened "xxxx.bitbucket.org", the browser did display the content of the file index.html.

I have a DNS name "www.yyyy.com" and I followed another document "https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Associate+an+existing+domain+with+an+account". But after setting the CNAME of my account, when I opened "www.yyyy.com", it was just mapped to "bitbucket.org/xxxx"

However, what I want to bind "www.yyyy.com" to "xxxx.bitbucket.org".

What should I do so that I could bind "www.yyyy.com" to "xxxx.bitbucket.org", but not "bitbucket.org/xxxx".
fields.summary: Questions about using bitbucket as a static website and name binding

fields.description:
If i made changes in WEB interface in WIKI and then click to cancel all my changes gone without confirm.

Please add confirm on cancel action if changes were made.

Honestly for a company that prides itself in security it's really really easy to delete a repository. 2 Clicks and gone? There really should be an email confirmation of deletion so that 1. the owner of the repository knows it's about to be deleted and 2. if you hit it by mistake it's not just gone. 3. if a hacker somehow manages to use the api to delete the repository it's not gone until you email confirm it's deletion.

I have a private repository on github I would like to import to bitbucket. Importing the repository through your https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/github is impossible as it doesn't even list it as an existing repository and actually it's completely missing from the list along with quite a few others. I already have imported it using the https://bitbucket.org/repo/import which I had significant trouble with also. As a side note you may want to tell users that if they have their github account linked they do not need to use the authentication fields as that actually hinders the import.

On the https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/github it is listing a total of 30 repositories on my github account. When github is telling me I have 75.
fields.summary: GitHub repository importer does not page through all repositories on account (BB-10127)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
SSH key was added as deployment key for some BitBucket repository.\\
I removed it from deployment keys.\\
I am not able to set this key as my SSH key for my account. I got message: "Someone has already registered this as a deploy key.".

I reviewed all projects we have at bitbucket and it seems that there was only one repository where we used it.
fields.summary: Not able to add old deployment key as SSH key

Hi, after committing changes to a remote branch, and then creating a Pull Request to merge them into Master, I was unable to merge. Furthermore, it seems I can no longer access the Master branch.

This is the reference ID 68d2687f0365477f8f06cf16559672bb
fields.summary: Unable to merge with Master or view the repository commits

fields.description:
Hi,

I've been trying to clone a repo I own onto a different computer. I have an ssh key set up for this computer, and have associated that key with my account, but I am still getting a 401 unauthorized access error:

git clone https://bitbucket.org/kenzshelley/phirhoscholarship\\
Initialized empty Git repository in /afs/umich.edu/group/soas/phisigma/Private/html/scholarship/phirhoscholarship/.git/\\
error: The requested URL returned error: 401 Unauthorized while accessing https://bitbucket.org/kenzshelley/phirhoscholarship/info/refs

fatal: HTTP request failed

I have no idea what's going on....any suggestions?
fields.summary: 401 unauthorized error when trying to clone my repo

fields.description:
I'm working with Erik van Zijst on issue importing and spam issues in general, and am noting that on the test repo I'm working with https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqla_exp_3/ I am not able to "approve" or "delete" any of the comments that askimet has marked as spam.   It's a separate issue that Askimet seems to mark all issues that aren't mine as spam in an issue import, but at least I should be able to mark these.

Example comments:

https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqla_exp_3/issue/1416/sessionget_bind-doesnt-separate-mapped#comment-8321104

https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqla_exp_3/issue/1390/postgresql-regular-expression-operators#comment-8319437

the issue applies to other repositories as well, such as Mako, can't approve this comment:

https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/mako/issue/184/templaterender_context-context-re-sets#comment-7502575

this issue renders the issue tracker largely unusable if comments can't be received.
Support code : bff60d11498847bf9c51a35ad1a0eaad

Just had a developer push 2 commits to Bitbucket (in a single push). We have a POST hook that reports the commits to a developer chatroom.

When the notifications for the two commits popped up in our chatroom it said the earlier commit was pushed to master (which nearly gave us a heart attack), but the more recent commit was pushed to the development branch (which is correct).

Both commits were pushed to the development branch.
fields.summary: POST hook reports wrong branch at times

fields.description:
ey.

An admin can delete himself out of a team (accidentaly or not) even if there is no other admin in that team. The  result is an team without an user with admin privileges. Happened to us. The solution should be not letting an solo admin out without other user being promoted.

(Please someone promote me to admin of this team: ratiiing)

I guess (?) it shouldn't be too difficult to add a Markdown Tool which would allow to preview md files before to commit them.  This would avoid the too many commits due to a missing blank line, etc.

The way I'm currently doing it is to go to the wiki, edit a dummy.md file, cut and paste from my local repo, switching from edit to preview and back.  When I'm happy with, I cancel (of course) the changes on the web side, and I'm doing a regular commit.  It works, but it is painful.

In brief: could you add a preview button when editing the README.md file?
fields.summary: Add a preview button when editing the README.md

fields.description: My repository {{apendua/impact-course}} seems to be broken. Every time I try to interact with it I get the {{500 Error}}. Can you please delete it from the server?
